p: The calibration test of the model specification selected on the basis of the lowest AICc showed encouraging predictive capacity: AUC train = 80.0, AUC test = 75.61, and CBI = 0.82. These results suggest that the predictor variables used during model calibration can predict the presence of R. ponticum in the Snowdonia National park with a fairly good degree of accuracy. Current distribution of R. ponticum on a continuous habitat suitability map for the present day LCCs is shown in Figure 2.
